comments: This course offers an introduction to, and an overview of, many of the key issues confronting urban public schools in America. Topics discussed during the semester include the historical, social, and cultural contexts of urban education and schooling in society.  Many of students that wrote reviews generally felt the course was valuable. Some students commented that there were, “definitely some logistical things that need to be worked out.” Students felt that there was not enough structure within the course.  The majority of students wrote praise of professor Bach. They felt that she was a, “strong professor who communicated the material effectively.” There were not general complaints of Professor Bach.  This course uses readings and class discussions, and popular media such as newspapers. It is listed as fulfilling the Cultural Diversity in the U.S. requirement. There are no prerequisites listed for this course.
